text: Which of the following is an example of a mixture?
explanation:
The Blood is a mixture which consists of water, proteins, fats, oil, sugar, vitamins, hormones, enzymes,e\ etc
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text:
Calculate the percentage by mass of nitrogen in calcium trioxonitrate (V)
[Ca = 40, N = 14, O = 16]
explanation:
Calcium trioxonitrate(V) is (CaNO\(_3\))\(_2\)
The molecular mass of CaNO\(_3\))\(_2\) =  40 + (14 + (16 X 3)) x 2 = 164
Relative molecular mass of nitrogen(N\(_2\)) = 14 x 2 = 28
% by mass of nitrogen in CaNO\(_3\))\(_2\) = \(\frac{28}{164}\) x \(\frac{100}{1}\)
= 17.073≈ 17.1%
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The droplets of water observed around a bottle of milk taken out of the refrigerator is due to the fact that the?

options.A: water vapour in the air around the bottle gains some energy from the bottle
options.B: temperature of the milk drops as it loses heat into the surroundings
options.C: saturated vapour pressure of the milk is equal to the atmospheric pressure
options.D: water vapour in the air around the bottle loses some of its energy to the bottle

explanation:
When a cold milk bottle is taken out from the refrigerator, the water vapor in the air around the bottle comes in contact with the cold surface of the bottle and gets condensed.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The volume of a given gas is V cm\(^3\) at a pressure P mm Hg. what is the new volume of the gas if the pressure is reduced to half at constant temperature?
explanation:
Given:
V\(_1\) =Vcm\(^3\)   P\(_1\) = P mmHg    V\(_2\) = ?     P\(_2\) =  \(\frac{P}{2}\)   At constant temperature ⇒ Boyle's Law
P\(_1\)V\(_1\) = P\(_2\)V\(_2\)
V\(_2\) = \(\frac{{P_1}{V_1}}{P_2}\)
= \(\frac{{P}\times{V}\times {2}}{P}\)
V\(_2\) = 2V
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: How many unpaired electron(s) are there in the nitrogen sub-levels?
explanation:
Nitrogen has 7 electrons in all.Its electronic configuration is = \(1s^22s^22p^3\)So, it has three unpaired electrons in its p-orbitals.Note that the p orbital can accommodate a maximum of 6 electrons

text: The stability of the noble gases is due to the fact that they?

options.A: have no electron in their outermost shells
options.B: have duplet or octet electron configurations
options.C: belong to group zero of the periodic table

explanation:
Noble / Rare gases belong to group 0 because they have no bonding electrons in their outermost shell to satisfy the octet rule for stability.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The maximum number of electrons in the L shell of an atom is?
explanation:
The maximum number of electrons present in a particular shell is calculated by the formula2n2, where “n” represents the shell number. For instance, K shell is the first shell and it can hold up to 2(1)2 = 2 electrons. Similarly, L shell is the second shell and it can hold up to 2(2)2 = 8 electrons.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Elements in the same period in the periodic table have the same?
explanation:
Elements within the same group have the same number of electrons in their valence (outermost) shells, and they have similar electron configurations. They exhibit similar chemical properties.
But elements in the same period can determined by the same number of shells.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: A noble gas with a high power of fog penetration used in aerodrome beacons is?
explanation: The noble gas with a high power of fog penetration used in aerodrome beacons is krypton. Krypton's light can penetrate dense fog better than other noble gases, making it ideal for airport approach lights where visibility in foggy conditions is crucial.

text:
Calculate the solubility in mol dm-3 of 40g of CuSO4 dissolved in 100g of water at 120°C?
[Cu = 64, S = 32, O = 16]
explanation:
Solubility = \(\frac{\text{number of moles of solution}}{\text{vol of solution}}\)
100g of water = 100 cm\(^3\) = 0.1 dm\(^3\).
CuSO\(_4\) = 160 g/mol
No of moles of CuSO\(_4\) in 40g = \(\frac{40}{160}\)
= 0.25 mol.
Solubility = \(\frac{0.25}{0.1}\)
= 2.5 moldm\(^{-3}\).
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Coffee stains can best be removed by?

options.C: a solution of borax in water

explanation:
Borax solution refers to sodium borax in water. it is used for cleaning purposes. borax is mildly alkaline and can help break down acidic stains, such as those from coffee
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Carbon (II) oxide is considered dangerous if inhaled mainly because it?

options.A: can cause injury to the nervous system
options.B: competes with oxygen in the blood
options.C: competes with carbon (IV) oxide in the blood

explanation:
Carbon monoxide is harmful when breathed because it displaces oxygen in the blood and deprives the heart, brain and other vital organs of oxygen.

text: Calculate the volume of 0.5 mol dm\(^{-3}\) H\(_2\)SO\(_4\) that is neutralized by 25 cm\(^3\) of 0.1 mol dm\(^3\) NaOH?
explanation:
Firstly, write a balanced equation for the chemical reaction:     H\(_2\)SO\(_4\)    +     2NaOH  →    Na\(_2\)SO\(_4\)  +   2H\(_2\)O
C\(_A\) = 0.5 mol dm\(^{-3}\)   V\(_A\) = ?    C\(_B\) = 0.1 mol dm\(^{-3}\)     V\(_B\) = 25 cm\(^3\)
N\(_A\) = 1    N\(_B\) = 2
\(\frac{{C_A}{V_A}}{{C_B}{V_B}}\) = \(\frac{N_A}{N_B}\)
V\(_A\) = \(\frac{{C_B}{V_B}{N_A}}{{C_A}{N_B}}\)
V\(_A\) = \(\frac{{0.1}\times{25}\times{1}}{{0.5}\times{2}}\)
V\(_A\) =  2.5 cm\(^3\)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following salts is slightly soluble in water?
explanation:
All sulfates are soluble except those of barium, strontium and lead. Calcium sulfate, silver sulfate and mercurous sulfate are slightly soluble in water, but calcium sulfate is rarely precipitated in reactions between the calcium and sulfate ions.

text:
What quantity of aluminum is deposited when a current of 10A is passed through a solution of an aluminum salt for 1930s?
[Al = 27, F = 96500 C mol -1]
explanation:
Q = It = 10 x 1930 ( given)
27g → 3F( since aluminum is trivalent)
27g → 3 x 96500
x → 19300
x = \(\frac{27 \times 19300}{3 \times 96500}\)
x = 1.8g
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: If a reaction is exothermic and there is a great disorder, it means that?

options.B: the reaction is in a state of equilibrium
options.C: there will be a large increase in free energy
options.D: there will be a large decrease in free energy

explanation:
If a reaction is exothermic and there is a great disorder for a spontaneous reaction to occur, a large decrease in free energy is evident.

options.C: increase the rate of the reaction
options.D: lowering the energy barrier of the reaction

text:

what happens to the equilibrium constant of the reaction above if the temperature is increased?
explanation:
This given equation shows the forward reaction is exothermic, which means an increase in temperature will cause the equilibrium position to shift to left to favor reactant formation, i.e K decreases

text: To a solution of an unknown compound, a little dilute tetraoxosulphate (VI) acid was added with some freshly prepared iron (II) tetraoxosulphate (VI) solution. The brown ring observed after the addition of a stream of concentrated tetraoxosulphate (VI) acid confirmed the presence of?

text: When iron is exposed to moist air, it gradually rusts. This is due to the formation of?

text: The correct order of increasing boiling points of the following compounds C3H7OH, C7H16 and C4H10 is?
explanation:
C3H7OH ( PROPANOL) ⇒ 97ºC
C7H16 ( HEPTANE ) ⇒ 98.42ºC ;and
C4H10 ( BUTANE ) ⇒ -1ºC
ALTERNATIVELY,
In general, the higher the molecular mass of a substance, the higher its boiling point. This is because larger molecules have more intermolecular forces of attraction, which must be overcome for the substance to boil. If the molecular masses of each of the compounds are calculated, propanol (60g/mol), heptane(100g/mol) while butane(58g/mol).
Arrangement in increasing order will be  C4H10 → C3H7OH → C7H16 - OptionD
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: One of the major uses of alkane is?
explanation:

text: Two hydrocarbons X and Y were treated with bromine water. X decolorised the solution and Y did not not. Which class of compound does Y belong?
explanation:
Bromine water is an orange solution of bromine. It becomes colorless when it is shaken with an alkene. Alkenes can decolorize bromine water, butalkanes cannot.
X is ethene which decolorizes bromine water showing that ethene is unsaturated.
Y is an alkane.

text: The compound that is used as an anesthetic is?

text: In the diagram above, the gas produced is?
explanation:
In the laboratory, nitrogen monoxide (NO), also known as nitric oxide, is commonly prepared by the reduction of dilute nitric acid with copper, resulting in the formation of copper(II) nitrate, water, and nitrogen monoxide gas.
The chemical equation for this reaction is: 4HNO\(_3\)  +  Cu → Cu(NO\(_3\))\(_2\)  +  2NO + 4H\(_2\)O
